required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory Drugs in Women With Postpartum Pre-eclampsia
clinical_study.official_title: Ibuprofen Versus Acetaminophen in Women With Severe Pre-eclampsia After Vaginal Delivery.

lead_sponsor.agency: Complejo Hospitalario Dr. Arnulfo Arias Madrid

clinical_study.source: Complejo Hospitalario Dr. Arnulfo Arias Madrid

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypertensive disorders of pregnancy are a major cause of maternal mortality and morbidity, especially in developing countries. Postpartum hypertension can be related to persistence of gestational hypertension, preeclampsia, or preexisting chronic hypertension, or it could develop de novo secondary to other causes. The available data in the medical literature have primarily focused on antenatal and peripartum management. There are few data regarding the evaluation in women who are diagnosis with postpartum hypertension. Some medications that cause vasoconstriction are often used for pain relief, in women having perineal lacerations, episiotomy, or cesarean delivery. Such women usually require large doses of nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs that are associated with vasoconstriction and sodium and water retention, this drugs can result in severe hypertension.
The purpose of this study is to evaluate maternal postpartum hypertension in women with severe preeclampsia treated with nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs or acetaminophen.

detailed_description.textblock: Our objective is evaluate Ibuprofen or acetaminophen used for pain during the postpartum period in women with severe pre-eclampsia. We include only women with vaginal delivery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: levels of hypertension up to 4 days post paertum
primary_outcome.description: hypertension during the postpartum using acetaminophen or nonsteroidal antiinflammatory

secondary_outcome.time_frame: complications during the postpartum period (4 days)

arm_group.description: Experimental: Ibuprofen 400 mg each 8 hours for 2-3 days.
Acetaminophen 1 g oral each 6 hours, 2-3 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Vaginal delivery severe pre-eclampsia severe gestational hypertension aggregate pre-eclampsia
Exclusion Criteria:
sensitivities to ibuprofen cesarean delivery

overall_official.affiliation: Complejo Hospitalario Caja de Seguro social

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Complejo Hospitalario Dr. Arnulfo Arias Madrid
responsible_party.investigator_title: Gynecology and obstetric, investigator and teaching proffesor
